data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
What crystal system does compound 2 belong to?
What is the yield percentage of [Ni(acac)2(L1)]⋅3CH3CN⋅6H2O?
Does the PXRD pattern of compound 1 change significantly after the removal of guest molecules?
data.answer: No, the PXRD pattern for the sample after removal of the guest molecules is very similar to that of the pristine sample.

data.question: What is the purpose of heating a mixture of Ni(acac)2(H2O)2, L1, CH3CN, and CH2Cl2 at 70°C?
data.answer: To synthesize single-crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction of [Ni(acac)2(L1)]⋅3CH3CN⋅6H2O.

data.question: Is the density of compound 2 greater than 1.0 Mg/m^3?
What is the final R index (I>2sigma(I)) for compound 1?
Can compound 1 adsorb aromatic molecules such as toluene, xylenes, and nitrobenzene?
data.answer: Yes, compound 1 readily adsorbs aromatic molecules such as toluene, xylenes, and nitrobenzene.

data.question: What happens to the weight of compound 1 after exposure to toluene vapors?
data.answer: The weight of compound 1 increases after exposure to toluene vapors.

data.question: What is the space group of compound 2?
Does the framework of compound 2 remain intact upon complete removal of all included CH3CN and water molecules?
data.answer: Yes, the framework of compound 2 remains intact upon complete removal of all included CH3CN and water molecules.

data.question: What is the purpose of incorporating chiral crown ethers into the walls of nanotubes?
data.answer: To render the nanotubes useful for enantioselective processes.

data.question: What is the absorption coefficient of compound 1?
Are the CD spectra of compounds 1 and 2 mirror images of each other?
What is the pitch of the right-handed helix in compound 2?
Does the removal of guest molecules from compound 1 affect its ability to adsorb aromatic molecules?
data.answer: No, compound 1 can still adsorb aromatic molecules after the removal of guest molecules.

data.question: What is the yield percentage of [Ni(acac)2(L2)]⋅2CH3CN⋅5H2O?
What is the effect of heating a mixture of Ni(acac)2(H2O)2, L2, CH3CN, and CH2Cl2 at 70°C for two days?
data.answer: To synthesize single-crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction of [Ni(acac)2(L2)]⋅2CH3CN⋅5H2O.
